entry.title: Why DeFi Speculators Are Borrowing Ethereum as Merge Looms
entry.summary: DeFi degens are borrowing ETH in the hopes of getting airdropped a new coin if there's a fork after the merge. Now pools are limiting the borrowing.

entry.title: This Week in Coins: Bitcoin and Ethereum Rebound, LUNA Moons
entry.summary: The new British government sounds bullish on crypto, while discussions in Washington about regulation are intensifying.

entry.title: MicroStrategy Is Considering Buying Even More Bitcoin
entry.summary: The firm filed with the SEC to sell up to $500 million in Class A stock. Guess what it may want to spend the proceeds on.

entry.title: Ethereum Successfully Deploys Final Network Test Before Merge
entry.summary: The network’s 13th and final shadow fork executed today with no apparent issues, say Ethereum core devs.

entry.title: Warren, Sanders and Other Senators Demand Meta Do More to Combat Crypto Scams
entry.summary: U.S. senators have written a letter to Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg, questioning the company’s commitment to stamping out crypto scams on Facebook.

entry.title: Terra Comeback? LUNA Surges 166% After LUNA Classic’s Own Rise
entry.summary: LUNA is crypto’s largest gainer today among the top 100 coins—and it comes right after LUNA Classic had its own unexpected ascent.

entry.title: Coinbase’s Ethereum Staking Token Is Trading at a Discount—Here’s Why
entry.summary: Analysts say cbETH works differently than its competitors, and that may make it less appealing.

entry.title: Mark Cuban Responds to Dogecoin Founder Diss: 'Everyone Can Say What They Want, I’m Still a Huge Fan of Crypto'
entry.summary: Jackson Palmer, who co-created Dogecoin, fired shots at the “Shark Tank” entrepreneur, saying Cuban had been “indoctrinated” into crypto.

entry.title: Quentin Tarantino, Miramax Settle Lawsuit Over 'Pulp Fiction' NFTs
entry.summary: The battle over Secret Network's Tarantino NFTs—with one already sold for $1.1M—is finished, with a possible collaboration with Miramax teased.

entry.title: Merriam-Webster Adds ‘Metaverse’ and ‘Altcoin’ to Dictionary in Nod to Crypto
entry.summary: Dictionary publisher Merriam-Webster added a fresh batch of crypto terms to its lexicon, like "Altcoin," "Metaverse," and "Unbanked."

entry.title: ApeCoin Leads NFT, Metaverse Token Rally With Double-Digit Gains
entry.summary: Several metaverse tokens, including ApeCoin, Flow, Axie Infinity, and Flow, are enjoying sizable gains over the past day.

entry.title: Revolving Games Raises $13.2 Million to Develop ‘AAA Quality’ Web3 Games
entry.summary: The gaming startup has backing from Polygon, Dapper Labs, and other prominent names.

entry.title: Economic Secretary Wants UK to Be ‘Country of Choice’ for Crypto Space
entry.summary: The Treasury official backed the Truss government’s intention to turn the UK into “a global hub for crypto technologies.”

entry.title: FTX Ventures Scoops Up 30% Stake in Scaramucci's SkyBridge Capital
entry.summary: Sam Bankman-Fried's FTX Ventures has reportedly acquired a 30% stake in Anthony Scaramucci's SkyBridge Capital.

entry.title: Google Cloud to Validate Transactions on Axie Infinity’s Ronin Network
entry.summary: Sky Mavis has added Google to its growing roster of firms to help secure the gaming-centric Ethereum sidechain network.

entry.title: Bitcoin Reclaims Key $20,000 Mark Amid Crypto Market Rebound
entry.summary: Bitcoin, the market's largest cryptocurrency, hit a two-week high Friday morning, outperforming most of the other top tokens.

entry.title: Florida Man Pleads Guilty to Stealing $100 Million in Crypto Ponzi Scheme
entry.summary: Joshua David Nicholas convinced investors that a high-tech bot was helping to earn them daily returns.

entry.title: Queen Elizabeth II Ethereum NFT Tribute Project Holds Final Auction
entry.summary: After releasing dozens of pixel portraits of the late monarch in recent months, the Nouns NFT fork will close its initial collection.

entry.title: Ethereum Name Service Creator Sues GoDaddy Over Expired Domain
entry.summary: The ENS says losing control of eth.link puts key services “under threat.”

entry.title: Investigators Recover $30M in Stolen Crypto From Axie Infinity Hack
entry.summary: About 10% of the crypto funds snatched from Axie’s Ronin network have now been seized by law enforcement, according to Chainalysis.

entry.title: White House: Bitcoin Mining Must Be Greener—Or US Should Ban It
entry.summary: The White House has said it wants federal agencies and states to make mining cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin more climate-friendly—or else.

entry.title: Web3 Investor Animoca Brands Raises Another $110M for Open Metaverse
entry.summary: Animoca, a leading investment firm and NFT game publisher, just added to its coffers via some fresh institutional investors.

entry.title: SEC Chair Gary Gensler Backs Giving CFTC Bitcoin Oversight
entry.summary: While Gensler has previously said Bitcoin is a commodity, he’s kept quiet about the status of Ethereum.

entry.title: Coinbase Backs Tornado Cash Lawsuit Against U.S. Treasury
entry.summary: "Code is speech and free speech is a constitutional right worth protecting," one of the plaintiffs said.

entry.title: Decrypt-O's Ep. 1: Tornado Cash Privacy Fears, Bored Ape VMAs Hate, Sheriff Gensler
entry.summary: Eat your Decrypt-O’s! In the debut episode, Sander Lutz hits the street to ask people about their privacy concerns in the wake of the government’s Tornado Cash crackdown; Kate Irwin shares headlines on the wackiest Web3 stories, from Crypto.com sending a woman $10 million by accident to Eminem and Snoop Dogg getting Twitter hate for their Bored Apes; and Dan Roberts serves up a rant about Gary Gensler.

entry.title: Inside the World's First No-Coiner Conference
entry.summary: The Crypto Policy Symposium in London was a historic gathering of crypto skeptics—and nobody tried to sell me anything.

entry.title: Coinbase’s Stablecoin Proposal Expected to Earn MakerDAO $24M Annually
entry.summary: MakerDAO could begin earning a yield on its stablecoin reserves, but turning to Coinbase raises centralization concerns.

entry.title: Roll Upgrades Ethereum Social Token Platform With Memberships, Staking
entry.summary: Are social tokens ready for their moment in the crypto spotlight? Roll believes the tech is on the verge of enabling breakout adoption.

entry.title: Hubble, Creator of ‘Censorship Resistant’ Stablecoin USDH, Raises $5 Million
entry.summary: Led by Multicoin Capital, the fundraising round will expand support for USDH across the Solana network.

entry.title: Thousands Tune in to Fake Apple Crypto Scheme on YouTube: Report
entry.summary: As many as 70,000 people tuned in to watch a phony live stream purporting to be about Apple's metaverse and crypto plans.

entry.title: ‘She Will’ Director Launches NFT in Support of End Violence Against Women
entry.summary: Based on her film "She Will," Charlotte Colbert’s NFT will appear as part of an exhibition by female artists, with the proceeds going to charity.

entry.title: Ethereum Hits Fresh 2022 High Against Bitcoin as Merge Event Approaches
entry.summary: Amid the shaky crypto market outlook, Ethereum is now trading at the year’s high against Bitcoin, with the merge event just around the corner.

entry.title: Switzerland’s SEBA Bank Launches Institutional Ethereum Staking
entry.summary: In an effort to meet the “growing demand” from institution investors, SEBA is turning to Ethereum staking ahead of the merge.

entry.title: Celsius Had Been Insolvent Since 2019: Vermont Regulator
entry.summary: Court filings claim the cryptocurrency exchange artificially inflated the price of its native CEL token.

entry.title: Tether’s Lead Over USDC Hits $16B as Binance Moves to Limit Stablecoin Competitors
entry.summary: The market cap gap between Tether and USDC had narrowed to $10 billion earlier this year.

entry.title: NFT Game Consultant Says Poor People Could Be NPCs
entry.summary: It sounds like being a host in WestWorld, but less fun.

entry.title: 'Love Island' Twins Scolded by UK Regulator for 'Irresponsible' Crypto Ads on Instagram
entry.summary: The UK’s Advertising Standards Authority warned Eve and Jessica Gale from posting ads that “trivialize the investment in cryptoassets.”

entry.title: Binance US Launches High-Yield Ethereum Staking Just Days Before Merge
entry.summary: The company's staking-rewards rate for ETH nearly doubles that of some of its largest competitors.

entry.title: gm: Bitcoiner Dan Held Talks Ethereum Merge, PoW vs PoS, and NFTs
entry.summary: Dan Held is an old-school Bitcoiner who has been in the space since the very beginning; he sold his price app ZeroBlock to Blockchain.info in 2013. But while he's largely seen as a Bitcoin maximalist by his half a million fans on Twitter, he tells Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott he's a "permissive" and "open-minded" Bitcoiner: he's watching the Ethereum Merge closely, and he admits Ethereum's move to proof of stake will put pressure on Bitcoin's energy use. Watch Episode 18 of the gm podcast and make sure to subscribe on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: How Will the Ethereum Merge Affect Bitcoin's Image?
entry.summary: Experts agree the difference in energy use will put the two blockchains in stark relief.

entry.title: ETC Group to Launch New ETP for 'Imminent' Ethereum Hard Fork
entry.summary: London-based ETC Group announced that it will support the "imminent" fork of Ethereum following the network’s transition to proof-of-stake.

entry.title: Crypto Miner Bitdeer Delays $4B SPAC Deal Again
entry.summary: The SPAC taking crypto miner Bitdeer public at a $4 billion valuation has filed another extension, delaying the merger until December.

entry.title: #DecryptLIVE: ETH Merge Is on the Horizon
entry.summary: Decrypt’s Dan Roberts, Stacy Elliott, Jason Nelson, and Sander Lutz break down all the angles, from the timing to the expected market reaction to the technical elements.

entry.title: VCs and Family Offices Go Crypto: Hashed, Lux, Cleo, RW3 and Protofund at Crypto Bahamas
entry.summary: Baek Kim of Hashed, Grace Isford of Lux Capital, Sarah Kunst of Cleo Capital, Peter Najarian of RW3 Ventures, and Edward Moncada of Protofund talk to Decrypt's Dan Roberts onstage at FTX's Crypto Bahamas event about VCs and family offices allocating money into crypto and the outlook for institutional DeFi.

entry.title: From Silk Road to Buying ETH: How Musician Tycho Went Crypto
entry.summary: Scott Hansen aka Tycho, the musician, producer, and songwriter, tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin how he caught the crypto bug and why he believes Web3 can change the music industry for the better.

entry.title: gm: Decentralized Pictures CEO on How Web3 Can Change Hollywood
entry.summary: Decentralized Pictures, the nonprofit co-founded by Roman Coppola, is enabling on-chain voting to greenlight and fund film projects. CEO Leo Matchett tells Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves how the anti-crypto stigma in Hollywood is fading, how Web3 can bring more diversity to the film world and disrupt the traditional gatekeepers, and how he first got into crypto when he and Coppola set up a Bitcoin miner in an empty sound stage.

entry.title: Decrypt Learn: What Is a Node?
entry.summary: In this video, we’ll learn about a core component that defines Web3: blockchain nodes. A node is one of the many computers that power a decentralized network like Ethereum. Learn about the different types of nodes and why they’re part of the core infrastructure that make Web3 possible. Visit Infura.io today to start building. Written by: Clarissa Watson, Senior Tech Writer at ConsenSys.

entry.title: Decrypt on the Street: An NFT Trip to Tiffany's, a Search for Status
entry.summary: In this episode of Decrypt on the Street, reporter Sander Lutz jumps through hoops in the hopes of obtaining an exclusive "NFTiff" from Tiffany & Co. Sander learns manners and spiritual awareness from two coaches, only to fall short of the digital brass ring.
